revised_title: Observations of a Remarkable Meteor in Oxford, 1764
tldr: In March 1764, a remarkable meteor was observed in Oxford by the Reverend John Swinton. The meteor was a bright, white column that ascended from the southern part of the sky and remained visible for a few minutes before fading. Swinton described the event and its similarities to an Aurora Borealis, a rare phenomenon that had been observed in other parts of the world.
